name: DUMMY
descr: Error: You should not see this Item.

name: Water
descr: Clean drinking water. Also suitable for cooking or washing.

name: Dirty water
descr: Contaminated. Drink at your own risk.

name: Ravioli conserve
descr: Edible without cooking, but a feast looks different..

name: Gas cartridge
descr: For the gas cooker.

name: Cooked ravioli
descr: Much tastier now that it is cooked.

name: Uncooked pasta
descr: Too hard to eat raw, they have to be cooked first.

name: Pasta
descr: Dry, cooked pasta. The definition of 'boring food', but they fill you up.

name: Sauce in a jar
descr: Not tasty on its own, but adds flavour to your dry pasta.

name: Pasta with sauce
descr: Easy to make and delicious; not without reason the favourite food of many children.

name: Bread
descr: Like a white canvas: better with a coating on it.

name: Jam
descr: Sweet fruit spread. Boiling has made the fruit very long-lasting.

name: Bread with jam
descr: The classic breakfast par excellence.

name: Chlorine tablets
descr: Can be used to clean dirty water.

name: Flour
descr: Ingredient for baking, not edible on its own.

name: Salt
descr: The most popular spice; not to be confused with sugar.

name: Sugar
descr: The most popular sweetener; not to be confused with salt.

name: Rice
descr: Versatile side dish, especially popular with curry.

name: Pulses
descr: Underestimated all-rounders, rich in protein and often have a particularly long shelf life.

name: Fish
descr: Watch out for the fish bones!

name: Potatoes
descr: There are countless different ways to prepare these ever-popular tubers.

name: Vegetables
descr: Versatile and healthy, and particularly tasty when freshly harvested.

name: Fruits
descr: Sweet and healthy, perfect for a snack between meals.

name: Chocolate bar
descr: To enjoy, in moderation.

name: Meat
descr: Only a few varieties (and only very fresh pieces) are edible raw, the rest should be cooked thoroughly.

name: Tofu
descr: A source of protein, often used as a meat substitute.

name: Nuts
descr: Long-lasting sources of protein, iron and omega-3 fatty acids.

name: Cheese
descr: Sliced, cheese is a popular topping for bread.

name: Milk
descr: From a cow or from oats/soy/almonds.

name: Bolognese
descr: Pasta dish whose sauce contains more protein than an ordinary tomato sauce.

name: Juice
descr: Tastes best freshly pressed.

name: Salted Fich
descr: Longer shelf life than unsalted fish, but also ... saltier.

name: Pickled vegetables
descr: Longer shelf life than untreated vegetables.

name: Vegetable rice
descr: A popular dish that works with virtually any type of vegetable.

name: Curry with rice
descr: Depending on the recipe, somewhere between 'a little spicy' and 'VERY spicy'. The rice moderates the flavour a little.

name: Hummus with Bread
descr: Bread with a savoury chickpea spread, which is available in various flavours.

name: Cheese sandwich
descr: A classic among sandwiches.

name: Hot chocolate
descr: A warm treat for young and old.

name: Gulasch
descr: The stew-like dish warms from the inside.

name: Rice pudding
descr: Delicious dessert, traditionally eaten with fruit or cinnamon and sugar.

name: Soup
descr: Not only rich in nutrients, but also an excellent hydrator.

name: Batteries
descr: Rechargeable. Can be used to power various devices.

name: Soap
descr: You can shower without, but it's much more effective with.

name: Fried fish with chips
descr: Greasy, but delicious.

name: Fried fish
descr: Just what it sounds like: fried fish.
